trans-unit.source: A TYPO3-a-like theme with UI/UX improvements.
A modern makeover of the TYPO3 Backend with visuell improvements.
Select your favorite features to customize the TYPO3 Backend for your needs.
The preset Vanilla⁺ is based on the corporate design of TYPO3. Functionalities are not changed or added. There are only minor UI optimizations.

The 'Modern' preset activates all available features and optimizations of the Enhanced Backend extension. The UI/UX is based on current developments and there is a content tree that allows quick navigation over all content on a page.
This preset takes over the last selected settings (from the other presets) and allows individual dis-/enabling of individual features and optimizations.
These settings affect all areas of the TYPO3 backend.
These settings affect the top bar, where your login is located, for example.
These settings affect the sidebar on the left side of the screen where the different modules are located.
These settings affect the page tree, located to the right of the sidebar.
The content area is the area where the contents of the respective modules are shown from the sidebar.
This dialog becomes visible when creating a new content element.
Replace the default TYPO3 icons with a modern and user-friendly icon set.
Use the optimized "Inter" font for better display of elements and texts.
Use this option to make scrollbars more discreet and move them visually into the background.
The search field is brought more into focus and given a more modern design.
The username is moved to the upper right corner, as users are used to from other applications.
Move sidebar collapse toggle to bottom edge
Positions the sidebar collapse toggle from the upper left corner to the end of the sidebar.
Improves the color design of module entries, spacing and visual separation of groups.
Buttons get more spacing to be more clickable. The search field is displayed in a more modern way.
Inserts a tree below the page tree that maps the content elements of the currently selected page.
Content element frames are moved to the background to focus on the content. Buttons and titles are repositioned for a better overview. Also, all flags are hidden to reduce redundancy.
Spacing is consistent with the page tree toolbar. Larger click areas make the work easier.
Form elements are aligned using a grid. Frames are visually placed in the background so editors can focus on content.
The search box and tabs are provided in a more modern design.
Description texts are available as tooltips, icons and headlines are in focus.
